question.text: Choose the wrong statement from the following.

options.text: Failure of segregation of chromatids during cell division results in aneuploidy.
Additional copy of 'X' chromosome in males results in Klinefelter's syndrome.
Closely located genes in a chromosome always assort independently resulting in recombinations.
Failure of cytokinesis after DNA replication results in polyploidy.

solution.text: On chromosome several genes are present which are arranged in linear manner. Usually genes present on single chromosome have tendency to inherite together in next generation, this process is called Linkage and the genes are called linked genes. This linkage is inversely proportional to distance between genes as well as crossing over.
